feed.title: Lotus Tech Debuts its First PHEV, Advancing into Wider Markets
feed.summary: Lotus Technology Inc. has unveiled its first-ever plug-in hybrid (PHEV) model, marking a significant step in the brand's electrification strategy and expanding its reach into new powertrain segments. The model, which debuted in China's new-vehicle catalog on December 5, 2025, is scheduled for an official launch in China in Q1 2026, with international rollouts to follow. This move reflects Lotus's commitment to meeting diverse consumer demands in the evolving automotive market.

feed.title: Lotus Technology to launch its first plug-in hybrid model in 2026
feed.summary: Lotus Technology Inc. (NASDAQ:LOT) has announced the upcoming launch of its first-ever plug-in hybrid electric vehicle (PHEV) model in China during the first quarter of 2026, with international markets to follow. This strategic move comes as the company, valued at $322 million, navigates significant financial challenges including rapid cash burn and negative free cash flow. Despite a recent stock price decline, analysts maintain a bullish outlook on the company as it expands its portfolio beyond pure electric vehicles.

feed.title: Does Lotus’s Q3 2025 Revenue Drop But Narrower Loss Reshape The Bull Case For LOT?
feed.summary: Lotus Technology Inc. reported Q3 2025 results with a sharp revenue drop to US$137.43 million but a narrower net loss of US$65.42 million, signaling improving cost controls despite external pressures on vehicle deliveries. While current results highlight the tension between cost structure tightening and lower volumes, the investment narrative hinges on successful upcoming model rollouts, integration, and avoiding heavy cash burn, with a projected fair value of US$3.00 implying significant upside.

feed.title: Lotus Technology Inc. Earnings Call: Mixed Results and Strategic Moves
feed.summary: Lotus Technology Inc.'s recent earnings call revealed a mixed financial picture, with significant year-on-year declines in deliveries and revenue, yet notable improvements in gross margin and operating efficiency. The company is pursuing strategic initiatives including launching new hybrid models and expanding into markets like Brazil to foster long-term growth. Despite challenges such as external tariffs, Lotus maintains competitive strength in China and expects further gross margin improvements.

feed.title: Lotus Technology Inc. Reports Financial Results for Third Quarter and Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025, Highlights New PHEV Model Launch
feed.summary: Lotus Technology Inc. reported its financial results for the third quarter and first nine months of 2025, showing narrowed net losses and an improved gross margin despite an overall revenue decrease. The company plans to launch a new PHEV model to diversify its energy strategy and is advancing the strategic acquisition of Lotus UK to enhance operational efficiency. These initiatives aim to improve competitiveness and create long-term value in the automotive sector.

feed.title: Lotus Technology gains after pointing to margin improvement in Q3 (LOT:NASDAQ)
feed.summary: Lotus Technology (LOT) saw its shares gain after reporting a 40% year-over-year decline in deliveries to 4,612 vehicles for the first nine months of the year. Despite the delivery drop, the company indicated a margin improvement in Q3, with its primary markets being China, Europe, and North America.

feed.title: Lotus Technology Q3 Loss Narrows
feed.summary: Lotus Technology Inc. (LOTWW) reported a narrower net loss in the third quarter, primarily due to reduced operating expenses, despite a decline in revenue. The net loss attributable to shareholders decreased significantly from $205.80 million to $65.42 million year-over-year. However, total revenue decreased by 46% and vehicle deliveries shrank by 35%.

feed.title: Positive Sentiment Still Eludes Lotus Technology Inc. (NASDAQ:LOT) Following 27% Share Price Slump
feed.summary: Lotus Technology Inc. (NASDAQ:LOT) has seen its share price drop by 27% in the past month, contributing to a 62% decline over the last year. Despite this, its price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 1.5x is considered "middle-of-the-road" compared to the U.S. Auto industry's median of 1.1x. The company faces declining revenue, but a sole analyst forecasts significant revenue growth of 74% per annum for the next three years, outpacing the industry's projected 16%.

feed.title: Lotus Technology (NasdaqGS:LOT): Is the Market Missing Its True Value After Recent Share Declines?
feed.summary: Lotus Technology's shares (LOT) have seen significant declines recently, with a 66.2% drop over the last year, prompting questions about its true market value. Despite shrinking vehicle deliveries and ongoing net losses, analysis suggests the stock is 48.3% undervalued, with a fair value of $3.00, due to recent funding, innovative hyper-hybrid models, and projected explosive profit growth. This creates a debate on whether the market is overlooking future potential or accurately pricing in risks within the evolving EV sector.

feed.title: Lotus Technology Inc. Reports Second Quarter 2025 Results: 2,800 Vehicle Deliveries, $218 Million Revenue, and Funding Commitments
feed.summary: Lotus Technology Inc. announced its unaudited financial results for the first half of 2025, reporting $218 million in revenue and a narrowed operating loss of $263 million, a 40% year-on-year improvement. The company delivered over 2,800 vehicles, primarily in China, and secured approximately $500 million in funding commitments, alongside forming a strategic partnership for intelligent driving and Robotaxi development in Saudi Arabia. Despite a 45% decrease in year-on-year revenue, Lotus's CEO expressed confidence in its future resilience and value creation.

feed.title: Lotus Tech to acquire full ownership of Lotus UK
feed.summary: Lotus Technology Inc. (Nasdaq:LOT) announced it will acquire full ownership of Lotus UK by purchasing Etika Automotive's 49% stake and Geely International's stake through non-cash transactions. This move, expected to complete by end of 2025, will consolidate Lotus Tech's control over Lotus sports and hypercar manufacturing and engineering services. The acquisitions fulfill put option agreements initiated in January 2023, triggered by Lotus UK selling over 5,000 vehicles in 2024.

feed.title: Geely exercises its Put Option on Lotus UK, enabling reintegration of all businesses under the Lotus brand
feed.summary: Geely has exercised its put option to sell its 51% stake in Lotus UK back to Lotus Technology Inc., effectively reintegrating all Lotus businesses under one umbrella. This move aims to strengthen brand equity and enhance operational flexibility for Lotus, despite some concerns about Geely's departure from Lotus' BEV development. The transaction is expected to be completed this year and will be a non-cash transaction based on a pre-agreed pricing method.

feed.title: It's Down 30% But Lotus Technology Inc. (NASDAQ:LOT) Could Be Riskier Than It Looks
feed.summary: Lotus Technology Inc. (NASDAQ:LOT) shares have dropped 30% in the last month, contributing to an 81% decline over the past year. Despite superior revenue growth compared to its industry peers, the company's price-to-sales (P/S) ratio remains average, suggesting that investors may be skeptical of future forecasts or pricing in risks. The article highlights that analysts expect significant future revenue growth for Lotus Technology, outpacing the industry, but its P/S ratio does not fully reflect this positive outlook.

feed.title: NIO and Lotus Enter Into Strategic Cooperation on Charging and Swapping
feed.summary: NIO and Lotus have announced a strategic cooperation on charging and swapping at the 2024 Beijing International Automotive Exhibition, aiming to establish a unified battery standard system and shared charging infrastructure. This partnership will involve comprehensive collaboration in areas such as battery standards, charging and swapping technologies, battery asset management, and service network construction. Both companies emphasize the importance of cooperation to advance the premium smart electric vehicle market and provide efficient recharging services to users.

feed.title: Lotus Technology completes a satisfactory IPO
feed.summary: Lotus Technology, a luxury electric vehicle manufacturer, successfully completed its IPO on Nasdaq by merging with SPAC L Catterton Asia Acquisition Corp. The new entity, valued at around $7 billion, began trading on February 23, 2024, under the symbol "LOT". Shares rose 2.15% to $13.80, giving it a market capitalization of $9.3 billion.

feed.title: EV maker Lotus Tech closes up modestly in Nasdaq debut after SPAC merger
feed.summary: Lotus Technology (LOT.O) shares closed up 2% in their Nasdaq debut after completing a SPAC merger with L Catterton Asia Acquisition Corp, valuing the luxury EV maker at about $7 billion. Despite broader scrutiny on EV makers in capital markets, Lotus Tech aims to expand globally, having already launched two EV models and secured $880 million in financing. The debut saw significant share redemptions from the SPAC, leading to potential stock volatility.
